description: three large rowboats in foreground, filled with people; figure at front of boat at left stands holding oar over his head; small sailboat at far right in distance; sailing ship with sails unfurled at right in middle ground; other sailing ships at left without sails unfurled, in distance; buildings and hill on opposite shore; grey sky and water with a few low clouds at center
medium: Graphite and watercolor on blue-gray paper
provenance: [Colnaghi, London, until 1970; sold, January, for $84, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1970-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: View of the Bay of Naples
